channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- Newsletter Popup
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- Newsletter Popup

item.title: CVE-2023-0733|2024-08-02T05:24:33.509Z -- unknown -- newsletter%20popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow unauthenticated users to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks

item.title: CVE-2023-0766|2024-08-02T05:24:34.543Z -- unknown -- newsletter%20popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not have CSRF checks in some places, which could allow attackers to make logged in users perform unwanted actions via CSRF attacks as the wp_newsletter_show_localrecord page is not protected with a nonce.

item.title: CVE-2024-3642|2024-06-04T17:33:18.940Z -- unknown -- newsletter%20popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not have CSRF check when deleting subscriber, which could allow attackers to make logged in admins perform such action via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-3643|2024-05-16T06:00:02.799Z -- unknown -- newsletter%20popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not have CSRF check when deleting list, which could allow attackers to make logged in admins perform such action via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-3644|2024-06-04T17:32:34.623Z -- unknown -- newsletter%20popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-3641|2024-06-04T17:31:00.592Z -- unknown -- newsletter%20popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not sanitise and escape some parameters, which could allow unauthenticated visitors to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks against admins

item.title: CVE-2024-3641|2024-08-01T20:19:59.822Z -- unknown -- newsletter%20popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not sanitise and escape some parameters, which could allow unauthenticated visitors to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks against admins

item.title: CVE-2024-3642|2024-08-01T20:19:59.856Z -- unknown -- newsletter%20popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not have CSRF check when deleting subscriber, which could allow attackers to make logged in admins perform such action via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-3644|2024-08-01T20:20:00.100Z -- unknown -- newsletter%20popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-3643|2024-08-01T20:20:00.408Z -- unknown -- newsletter%20popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not have CSRF check when deleting list, which could allow attackers to make logged in admins perform such action via a CSRF attack
